intro: Achyrocline gertiana, commonly known as the Hawaiian bluebell, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are slender and often branched. Achyrocline gertiana is a rare species, with limited distribution and facing threats from habitat loss and invasive species.
